intro: Boschia mansonii, commonly known as the Manson's boschia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from yellow to red, and it is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution, Boschia mansonii is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
